title: Enhancing Programming Practical Competencies: Expanding Work-Integrated Learning (WIL) for Pre-Service Mathematics Teachers

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational mathematics education theories and practical teaching experience
context.additional_context: Practical Competency Enhancement Program for IT/Software Development Professionals

learning_goals: Completion of at least two real-world mathematics lesson design and implementation projects in collaboration with local educational institutions.

Based on WIL (Work-Integrated Learning) experiences, learners will write a 500-word self-reflection report, create a 5-minute presentation, and deliver it to peers/instructors, scoring 4/5+ in four of five rubric items (content organization, reflection depth, clarity of expression, visual aid utilization, presentation demeanor).
Submission of at least three lesson improvement plans incorporating peer evaluations and expert feedback.
Analysis of real educational problem-solving cases acquired during WIL, linked to mathematics education theories.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
